message_1:
Consider the following two propositions: 

1. p: It is raining today.
2. q: I will go to the movies tonight.

If p is true and q is false, what is the truth value of the proposition "If it is raining today, then I will go to the movies tonight."?
message_2: The proposition "If it is raining today, then I will go to the movies tonight" can be represented as an implication: p â†’ q. The truth value of an implication is false only when the antecedent (p) is true and the consequent (q) is false. In this case, p is true and q is false, so the truth value of the proposition "If it is raining today, then I will go to the movies tonight" is false.
